website_summaries.verdict: Thanks to plenty of apps and an affordable price, the original plastic Pebble remains a solid budget smartwatch pick.
pros: The Pebble Watch is waterproof, runs a ton of apps, and works with both iOS and Android phones
A new app store improves the whole experience
cons: A lack of touch screen and multitasking limits the capability of apps
scratch-prone polycarbonate design doesn't feel nearly as impressive as the Pebble Steel

customer_reviews.title: Out dated and no longer supported!
customer_reviews.text: This is an outdated model. The apps and watch faces no longer work. I was wondering why there is no review for last two years but i realized it the hard way that Pebble is shut down and that their servers and warranties are void when FitBit took it over. Amazon is not letting me post my original review for whatever reason , but i would suggest NOT to buy ANY pebble products from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Jyo

customer_reviews.title: Simple and useful
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy my pebble. I don't need all the fancy gadgets that a lot of other smart watched have. I notifies me of whose calling and what texts I am getting. The most useful time is when I am on my motorcycle, at the gym, or in my car or at a meeting when I don't want to or have time to check my phone... as I typed this I realized, I check my watch more than I check my phone, it is a great way to stay connected without being rude to those around you that you are physically with. Also great to verify those pesky "Phantom vibrations" when the phone is put away.
customer_reviews.author: The Romans

customer_reviews.title: Loved this watch
customer_reviews.text: This was an awesome watch. I wore it for months after i bought it. Replaced the band after awhile and always had a screen protector on it. I love the versatility of the watchfaces. Recently had to pawn some things and they offered me five dollars and I thought "Not in a million years would I sell this this watch for five dollars". Then not long after it was stolen from me. Browsing the new ones now. Think I'd upgrade but it would definitely still be a pebble upgrade. Kinda miss it lately and cant wait for the holidays, a raise, or Justice.lol
customer_reviews.author: Richard Fabris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome watch. My new favorite
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought the watch was doa but after about an hour of charging the watch turned on. Also the watch does not charge on every charger I have. It works on an ipad charger for me. *UPDATE* the charger wire is faulty. After the pebble would not charge again I connected it to a usb voltage meter and after bending and playing with the wire a bit he watch started charging again. I ordered a new (generic) charger for $7 I sure hope that fixes he probles as this is a really nice watch for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Cool Watch!!!
customer_reviews.text: I like it. its stylish. Different from what a 45 year man uses....referring to myself ....ajajjaj. Only thing is that I got the blurry screen issue. It happens whenever and I only have to press the back button and then all clears immediately and back to normal once again. So I search the web for the issue and I have to open the back and insert something to put pressure on a screen connector....looks simple , so I will try it and hopefully the watch will work as its supposed and Ill be a happier person. Also I hear the company that makes the watch is now closed. :(
customer_reviews.author: MTM

customer_reviews.title: The magnetic charging connector is relatively easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very durable and versatile! The magnetic charging connector is relatively easy to use. Battery life can vary between a few days to over a week with how much the bluetooth connectivity is used, but that shouldn't pose a problem if charged nightly. It will pair with most anything, including laptop PCs and Linux based single board computers like Raspberry Pi and Beaglebone. I did have some trouble with uploading to it from a Samsung Galaxy device. I use it often to interface with a Raspberry Pi running 'headless'. The Pebble is well supported in the Python programming language.
customer_reviews.author: B. Slagle

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life and functionality.  Beware of eventual display glitches.
customer_reviews.text: As amazing as these watches are, I've had two that eventually fell victim to the dreaded "screen tearing" issue. Other than that, I got a couple of years of use out of my first one and about a year of use out of the second one before the displays started to become unusable. On the plus side, however, the battery life is stellar; these can go without charging for about a week and a half. There are lots of apps that can be installed on these watches to extend their functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Troy W. Mcquinn

customer_reviews.title: Trust the negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: 3 months of using this 3 days a week, and it doesn't function anymore. I should not have gambled on it with this known issue. The screen is garbage and won't display anything correctly. Bought Apr 2016, dead Jul 2016. This is not a rare problem.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bond

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed with the product as pebble is a very reputable ...
customer_reviews.text: The product is not working in spite of charging for 24hours. I am very disappointed with the product as pebble is a very reputable brand. I am not sure if quality standards have taken a hit because they are made in China. I see only the pebble name on the phone and even if I hold any of the buttons for a period it does not switch on. Is there a reset facility? Kindly help me.
customer_reviews.author: Srinivasan R

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service Awesome! Watch DOA
customer_reviews.text: First, I wish there was a place to review the vendor. The used watch was dead on arrival. I was heartbroken. However, contact with the vender went professionally smooth and with apologies. They never asked me for a good review as many will though they don't deserve it. I am impressed with this seller’s tightening quick response and I will have absolutely NO problem purchasing from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta L Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great when it first came out but not so much now
customer_reviews.text: I'll start with the good. This watch feels really good on the wrist and E-ink was easy to see in most lighting situations. Now let's look at this in 2019. Smartwatches can be found for relatively cheap now and this unfortunately has not stood the test of time. It is limited to about 8 apps and is slow to connect. It's slow to use most apps nowadays. It lacks a touch screen and the bezel is small. You can find something better for about $30USD more.
customer_reviews.author: Kamelle Jaye

customer_reviews.title: TWO dead Pebbles in Two Weeks!
customer_reviews.text: This is the SECOND Pebble ordered in 2 weeks, from two different sellers. BOTH arrived dead, will not charge, turn on or pair at all! I have a Pebble 2 that works perfectly, so it has nothing to do with the Pebble app or my iOS. This thing is just crap. Returning AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: KG505

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. Very convenient to not have to pull my darn phone out of my pocket every 5 min to check what the text said, or what time it is, or what the weather is like outside. Battery life is sometimes over a week depending on how many messages/calls/emails I get in the average day. Like the inductive/magnetic charger. One heads up for those who download extra watchfaces (read: everyone): If you find that your watchface isn't responding or something seems awry - try looking to see if there is a software update for the watch. Happened to me a couple of times, and I was very confused the first time that my watchface stopped responding.
customer_reviews.author: Kinetica

customer_reviews.title: 80% of Apple Watch Functionality at 20% of the Price
customer_reviews.text: More useful than I thought. I got it as an experimental replacement for a fitbit, and it does the fitness stuff and much more for a similar price. I use it for: - message receipt and simple response - weather updates - calendar-at-a-glance - bus times - music control - stock prices The app store is okay, but a lot of the apps are not ready for prime time. They do half what they say they will, or the just don't work quite right, etc. It will take you a while to find and configure the apps that do what you want done reliably. But very satisfied in all.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Legate

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for a Smart Product But Customer Support Needs to Improve
customer_reviews.text: This watch really serves me well when it comes to notification receipts. I wish it had more apps to pair with, when it came to health tracking. I had a small issue of a button coming off, but customer support was quick to replace it with a new one. In recent days though, ever since Fitbit bought Pebble, I've had some issues with updates that have run my battery down too quickly. Sadly, customer support isn't as responsive as they were last year. I wonder if this will now be the status quo.
customer_reviews.author: AV

customer_reviews.title: What's great about this little
customer_reviews.text: What's great about this little watch is all the neat things you can download to it, and use it for. Most of all, it's great at work because I just keep my phone on silent in meetings but can still read texts, emails, and see who's calling all on my watch. If it needs my immediate attention, I just leave the meeting to utilize the restroom and use my phone while no one knows the difference. I never thought I would use it for this purpose, but it really does help you maintain a professional appearance at work since your cell phone isn't constantly going off.
customer_reviews.author: MIL-SPEC Landscaping

customer_reviews.title: I really like it for the simplicity and value
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one that I have purchased. I really like it for the simplicity and value. I couldn't imagine spending several hundred on an apple watch, and I don't need all the other functions. I only ordered another because I damaged my original. Just be aware that Pebble is no longer around and they have no warranty or support. Also, the apps and watch faces may no longer be available at some point. They are also not doing updates for future bluetooth changes.
customer_reviews.author: steve d

customer_reviews.title: Perfect watch for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: Over two years and running without a issue. I used to call this a semi-smartwatch, because it's not touch screen. Only thing I would change is the band. My first band broke after about a year. Although, it was my fault and not a flaw. Anyways, this watch is my lifeline. It does one thing that has always helped me. When I am about 30 to 50 feet from my phone. The watch unlinks from Bluetooth and vibrates my wrist. That alone has paid for itself. I can see it's screen day and night perfectly. It can take beating. Way worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: I have one of my own and have loved it since
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased a second one for an Xmas gift. I have one of my own and have loved it since. Pebble provides great support when needed. The watch itself is lightweight though on the slightly bulkier side. The battery life is truly remarkable, I easily go 3 - 5 days on a single charge. The firmware was recently updated to be more in line with the new Pebble Time interface which was a nice surprise as well. The new animations and interface are fun and playful. The e-ink display is fantastic, easy to read in any lighting situation. It may not be as advanced as newer smartwatches but it's still an incredibly solid experience all around.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie McNeil

customer_reviews.title: The first and best smart watch to work with an Iphone!
customer_reviews.text: I primarily bought this to be able to see txt messages and who calls while I am in meetings without being rude and pulling out my phone. I bought one for my wife (Android OS) and for my work phone (IOS). The pedometer function is great, and it seems they are releasing new apps and watch faces daily. I swim with it every day and there is no issues at all. The watch band is a standard 22mm band size, so you can replace the strap to personalize it. Charge time is approximately 3-5 days depending on notifications. At $100, you cant go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Watch has known issues with the screen going bad. They will make you think you broke it though.
customer_reviews.text: Item stopped working in less than a month. Needless to say, through regular use the screen just crapped out. Went the rounds with Pebble customer service about the warranty and they wouldn't replace it. Kept telling me I did something to break it when I know I didn't, it just was a shoddy watch. Luckily Amazon took it back.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for notifications
customer_reviews.text: The watch is perfect for my needs. It delivers the notifications I want to the watch and none of the notifications that I block. I use this primarily when my phone is on silent at work but I still want to get sports updates and text messages. The battery life is great, I bought my pebble used and a single charge lasts about 5 days.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about it - but had some issues.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE the pebble. Great watch. The only issue is that the screen became garbled after just 3-4 uses. A quick Google search told me this was common. Not good. Went on the Pebble site and for that issue they suggested to contact support. They got back to me right away saying they will send a replacement. Waiting for the new one. Hope it doesn't happen again. We'll have to wait and see. Also, in general I thought the casing of this black (non-steel) version seemed a little flimsy and the plastic band can be a bit sweaty. When it's working, I really can't say enough good things about it. Very handy. Love the music feature.
customer_reviews.author: Picky bee-eye

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got the black Pebble watch for Father's Day 2015. I have had it 3 or 4 weeks now and I LOVE IT!!! I'm a heavy equipment operator and the reason I wanted this particular gadget was simple weather updates, time, text alerts, news updates, who's calling, pandora music control and a few other minor things. Works perfectly! I have taken it scuba diving as well! It is supposed to be good (resistant) to 164'.... WHAT???. I've had it about 15' so far and I plan to test to about 60'-80' so we'll see. And so far mine lasts 8days per charge. I do turn it off at night however
customer_reviews.author: Southshore

customer_reviews.title: I love thiswatch
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. I am a techie and I love being able to not only change the face of this watch, but also develop my own watch faces and apps. It is a lot of fun! Also, it is very convenient seeing text messages and incoming calls on the watch while your phone is in your pocket. The phone also keeps it's charge for many days. Overall I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: sharon m.

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, but minor glitches.
customer_reviews.text: This smartwatch fit the bill perfectly. I bought it primarily to make it easier to record my golf scores, as it supports an app that I use. It took a few tries to get used to, but by and large it works as advertised. It also has watchfaces that are more interesting than the standard ones found on regular watches, such as current locations, and weather conditions and temperatures. I'm sure there are lots more. I withhold a perfect score due to what seems to be some glitches in the linkage with the golf app, which too often requires in-game corrective actions to the app. Hope they fix that.
customer_reviews.author: Oswald Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: I feel in love with my Pebble and hope to replace it. Mine was stolen within two weeks by our "professional cleaner" from Homejoy. I have filed a report. As a nurse, looking at a cell phone is not only rude, it's distracting. This allowed me to field my messages and only respond if it was an emergency. Purchased because my son was involved in a roll over accident and I did not find out until 3 hours later due to the "no cell phone" policy at my place of employment. He could not remember the number.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Run away.
customer_reviews.text: So sad. This is my third pebble smart watch. They just don't last. As Im writing this this one is failing. I really like them. Great concept but life is terrible, only had one that lasted a year and the warranty is almost worthless. It took months before I got it replaced and the replacement quit after 3 months. They need to be cheaper if they are supposed to be as disposable as my watches have been. Would have been 5 stars otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: James K. Trisler

customer_reviews.title: Meh....
customer_reviews.text: I've had the watch more than 3 months and I still wear it everyday. I work in a school environment, so I wanted a watch that would allow me to leave my phone in my pocket, out of sight and still receive text, email, and call notifications. This is perfect for that. I can control the music in my phone, great for running and driving. The screen acts up occasionally, but nothing big. The alarms are nice. Don't make this your main fitness tracker. It's not accurate and sometimes has syncing problems with Misfits software. Get the Fitbit charge 2 if this is important to you.
customer_reviews.author: South wind style

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hardware bundled inside a small light plastic box!
customer_reviews.text: Just a few days with my Pebble and I love it!!! Easy to use, simple design, great apps, and if you want to add functionality I recommend getting Smartwatch+ and PebbleCam (Yes, the little monochrome screen serves as a 2nd screen for your phone's camera!). It is very flexible when it comes to customization, you can even customize the watch face ( or download from other developers (either from Pebble's App or from  You can even use Google Maps and get turn by turn directions directly to your wrist. In a nutshell, it has been only three days and I really love the little hardware. I'm using it along with an iPhone 5S with iOS 7.2.1.
customer_reviews.author: Orion F. Reyes Galaviz

customer_reviews.title: You might want to check out Pebble Steel instead
customer_reviews.text: I was not very pleased with this purchase. I got the watch delivered on Friday and left for Mexico the next day. With it being entirely charged and synced to my phone I was excited. Two days later it completely dies and I am left in Mexico with no watch. I tried to get Pebble to respond to no avail but luckily, Amazon is awesome at customer service and I was able to return it and get a replacement. This tie I got the Pebble Steel, it seems more hardy than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Cinda L Bitz

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, efficient, and multi functional
customer_reviews.text: If you want something fashionable you can drop cash on an Apple watch and charge it every night. If you want something with countless utilities that only needs charging once or twice a week, a standard pebble will do wonders for a fraction of the price. The screen is small and simple, and there's no microphone on it. Otherwise, the sheer number of apps and faces give this a huge lead over other watches, and the battery life is exceptional. I've had my phone on silent for almost an entire year now, and I've never missed a thing.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE

customer_reviews.title: Handy and you aren't given unreadable Chinese instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch! Been looking for different kinds of Smart watches, and I've tried a handful of Chinese Knock offs - only to understand you're gonna need to spend a bit more for something fully functional. This is great, hooks right up through an app on your phone (one you can find and not via a Chinese developer). Allows for you to install different apps such as health related, or customization apps like appearance of the clock etc. I installed a way to get notifications from sms and send basic pre-defined sms msg's. Quite a handy tool!
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: The pioneer of smart watches, and still one of the best ones on the market.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Just don't do like me and fall out of a cave while hiking and crack it and then immediately go swimming afterwards. Genius. While this watch IS very durable and water resistant, don't expect it to perform miracles. Water resistance ratings exist for a reason. Many other reviews can help you understand the functionality, but I just want to make you aware that it has its durability limits.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan K. Creates

customer_reviews.title: been working perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I was kind of scared to receive my watch once I started reading all these reviews saying that theirs wouldn't even turn on or charge right out of the package but it's been working amazingly. Make sure you're buying a new one and not a refurbished one. And if you're looking to buy a simple but useful watch try this one. Like the name, it's a classic . I'll probably be back to edit this if anything goes wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Bad luck with my watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch on May 2014, worked perfectly for a couple of months only. Since a few software upgrades from Pebble.com, the screen started to show black and white lines randomly or always when I push any of the 3 buttons on the right to access the menus. I cannot get the Setting menu or change a face, because everything is blurry. I have a friend who has also the same model but his watch is working fine. Maybe mine came defective and will not be able to return it because I live far outside US.
customer_reviews.author: Camilo Guerra, Peru

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for use with Dexcom
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my daughter's Dexcom G5. She has Type 1 Diabetes. I couldn't live without it now. I can see her blood glucose and trend with a quick glance at my wrist. It vibrates every 5 minutes to let me know there is a new number available. There's almost no lag between my Galaxy S5 and the watch. The screen is always on and I get about 3 days out of each charge. Also, it only takes about an hour to completely charge it back up. I wear it all the time, even in the pool and shower. It's been perfect for my needs.... love it!
customer_reviews.author: InOhio

customer_reviews.title: Cheap smartwatch - software issues
customer_reviews.text: I've had to order multiple Pebbles because I kept running into issues with mine randomly stopping working, then Pebble upgraded me to the nicer one for free and still had the same issues. You're getting what you pay here... there's a reason it's cheaper than the other smart watches.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I'm a copycat buyer from a friend
customer_reviews.text: The Pebble is awesome. I would buy it again ASAP. So cute and simple. Very user friendly. User-created content for apps make it friendly. If you get one and worry about it blinking ot not charging, take a quick Q-Tip with rubbing alcohol to the port on the watch and the actual charger end.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great android accessory
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely light watch and really eliminates the need to keep pulling out your phone to see messages/calls. It has a fast growing development following and free apps/faces are available. Looks stylish and I recommend getting the face protector since this is made ENTIRELY of plastic and I can foresee the scratches already. If you're looking for a watch to make calls/send messages, this is not for you. At this price point it's merely a minimalistic gadget and maybe you should wait until Google or other developer come out with the next big thing.
customer_reviews.author: James DeMichael

customer_reviews.title: it's a good start just falls short in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: The pictures of the screen really don't accurately reflect the actual resolution or brightness. I had trouble seeing the digitals in general. It does have a backlight but it only stays on for a brief moment so it's almost unuseable. I returned it within 24hrs. The other problem is you can't modify the notifications - for ios 8 which ever notifications you get on your phone is what you get on the watch -- I don't need every email, text etc. I need meeting notification anyway, it's a good start just falls short in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: LynnTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great invention, but screen distorts after a few months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Great features, simple to use, but screen gets distorted after a few months of use. There is a temporary fix discussed on Pebble forums: press the middle button for Menu, and then press the top and bottom buttons simultaneously, keeping them both down for 60 seconds. This fix clears the screen briefly. But it is only temporary.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Chung

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, iOS texts are intermittent at best
customer_reviews.text: One thing you have to realize is that for iOS you will not get text messages consistently. There is a problem with the Pebble and iOS text messages. If you peruse the Pebble support sites you'll see this is a pervasive problem. There are gyrations you can perform to make it work for a few hours but inevitably it will stop getting texts. Phone announcement work fine as to all the other apps. This may be an bug or a version issue that will be resolved in the future but be aware of this before you buy it.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: For that purpose it works great. The battery on this thing lasts forever on ...
customer_reviews.text: I actually only use this when I go play golf, because I'm generally not a watch person. I wanted the Pebble to use with the golf GPS apps. For that purpose it works great. The battery on this thing lasts forever on a single charge, several days. It's also very convenient with the notifications.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Hwip

customer_reviews.title: I think it was a good start to a line of epaper watches
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these, with the first one crapping out on me in the first month. The screen ultimately goes pixelated and is hard to read. You have to constantly change the screen to refresh it to make it able to be read. I switched to the Moto 360 now that the price has come down. I can't see paying $100 dollars for a smartwatch with limited options when for $50 more, you can get one that was designed to interact and do more. I think it was a good start to a line of epaper watches, but there needs to be a lot of redesigning.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Works with iPhone
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a smart watch for an iPhone, this is a great option. I get notification of my calls, emails, and texts, really anything you get a notification about on your phone will push to the watch. It also has great apps that can go with it, either as stand alone apps or companion apps. I have really enjoyed the sleep app; it tracks your sleep patterns, and wakes you up at an optimal time. I highly suggest this watch to go with iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica G.

customer_reviews.title: Simply Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome smart watch. And after a year and a half of ownership it is still awesome and keeps getting better with each firmware upgrade. I have other smart watches and the battery life on those is a little over a day at best. The Pebble lasts for five days in most cases. It is not the fanciest but it is the most practical and dependable out of the smartwatches that are available today.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Entry Level Smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: Have had this bad boy for a long time. Very pleased with the watch itself and the company overall. Got some dead pixels in the screen several months back. Contacted tech support. They sent me a brand new one. Then someone the dead pixels returned to life. As to the screen tearing I just press the buttons a few times and it clears up. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Bing Kaz

customer_reviews.title: OMG - what a deal!
customer_reviews.text: A great choice for a watch bought specifically for wear and tear use, at a ridiculously inexpensive price ($19.99). I already have the Pebble Steel, which I baby a bit, so this is a great backup watch, and it's nice looking too. Even though Pebble was sold to Fitbit and there is no corporate technical support for Pebble watches, all the apps are still available and working just fine.
customer_reviews.author: MMMM

customer_reviews.title: ... it cause it didn't come with a charging cable like it says it does in the item description
customer_reviews.text: I just got it today and can't even use it cause it didn't come with a charging cable like it says it does in the item description. I might change my review of this gets fixed fast. So a week later got the cord and after full charge started using it and the screen stopped working. So don't buy any pebble product cause I'm sure they are all defects just like my watch.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan noll

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for simple notifications
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot. I did not want a watch that tried to do everything a phone could do - just show me text messages and Caller ID. It's great not having to did my phone out of my coat or back pocket to see these notifications. Even around the house I can be upstairs and the phone is downstairs and its works fine. Only downside is my phone pretty much drains its battery every day because of using Bluetooth. Before that I could go two days before charging. The custom watch faces are pretty cool as well
customer_reviews.author: Ronspr

customer_reviews.title: Great item and community
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is awesome 4 days heavy usage Custom apps You can make your own if you wanted to Only issue no heart rate and not water proof You will be missed pebble
customer_reviews.author: Michael, The Sir Ov' Sir's

customer_reviews.title: Incredible deal.
customer_reviews.text: Ok...you want a bluetooth watch that works with an ANDROID. Specifically the Galaxy S6 (note the Casio G shock won't even try). This is a tough watch. I work in investigations as in fires, wrecks, bad stuff...fantastic tough worthwhile watch...lasts about 4 days on a charge. For the price $99.00 it tells me who is calling, who is texting without having to have my phone on. (nice in a quiet operation where beeping means bad stuff).
customer_reviews.author: Tacoma

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunate hardware error
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the watch's battery is shot and so it's stuck in a boot cycle. Tried the charging on the error screen trick but that didn't work no matter how many tries I made or however long I left it charging (charged overnight, still didn't work) But, hey, the actual watch is in great shape, the screen still looks like it works, and, honestly, it looks kind of like it's never been opened before despite it saying used. So props to the seller
customer_reviews.author: Luke Derderian

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!+ Read for a tip on how to get the charging cord to stay on.
customer_reviews.text: Great watch! I've been using this watch for about 2 months now, and I really like it. I will say that, like most people I was having issues with the charging cord falling off. I discovered that the magnets were not quite touching the metal dots on the side of the watch. I put a paperclip into the holes that are on the outside of the charger, and pushed the magnets out just a wee bit. I now have no issues at all and am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Emperor

customer_reviews.title: great for work
customer_reviews.text: After repeated use I am seeing some screen issues, and I noted more features are available when connected to a newer phone. After three months the screen has been showing static lines and going in and out. I am becoming dissatisfied with such an expensive purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: Firmware version 2.8.1 is a complete disaster
customer_reviews.text: pebble was reasonably accurate in its step count and could filter out false steps like not counting hand movements while driving or eating as steps. That changed with version 2.8.1 update of firmware. It now counts at least 30-50% more steps. Pebble really needs to keep a better check on its developers and QA and stop pushing reckless updates - it's an immature company in terms of supporting an ecosystem. I wouldn't be surprised if it is irrelevant in two years unless they fix issues and stop breaking things with every upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Yogi

customer_reviews.title: This is the best little watch
customer_reviews.text: This is the best little watch. Great for tracking my fitness, good battery life and an attention grabber. I get comments and questions about it almost every time I wear it out in public. I did a lot of research on smartwatches and was considering a fitbit but this one really does it all, especially for the price. Of coarse my ultimate choice is the apple watch but dang those are expensive! This one fits for me perfectly in the mean time. Zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: JVick

customer_reviews.title: VERY satisfied,  highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: The watch is refurbished and it works GREAT, the seller described it with feather scratches on several places, they must have been looking at it with a magnifying glass because I did not see any scratches at all. A tad disappointed that it doesn't have a pedometer feature but that is not why I purchased in the first place. I am incredibly satisfied with my purchase and the seller's customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Renee S

customer_reviews.title: Found the perfect smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: Own 3 smartwatches now, including a Samsung Gear 2. This simple Pebble classic is my favorite, the one I use all the time. The permanent readability in the sun is a big plus, so is the seven days battery.This little watch gives me all I need from a smartwatch. My smartwatch phone stays in my drawer, I like my LG G3 phone much better than any smartwatch with a phone capability.
customer_reviews.author: Louis D.

customer_reviews.title: Not for active people
customer_reviews.text: I work as a gymnastics coach. It lasted about a month in the gym before it gave out.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Will be worth for a first time
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to understand the hype of having a smartwatch nowadays. I was pretty skeptical buying this, because I thought I would only use it for a week or even less. Wrong. After knowing about the Pebble apps, it became a complement for everything I do (call, manage music, manage todo lists). So, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this watch and the company that makes it. They even managed to upgrade the software on this model with very limited resources. I like to keep my phone on vibrate only, but I sometimes miss the vibration when it's in my pocket. I rarely miss the Pebble vibrate on my wrist, however. The watchface customizations are unbelievable, and reminders, text alerts, and media control work well with my Android phone.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: So amazing. Great battery life
customer_reviews.text: So amazing. Great battery life. I love having my phone on AUX to my stereo while i work and being able to skip songs, and when my wife calls or texts i can tell by looking at the watch, thus saving me from getting yelled at for not responding or answering. Even while mowing i can feel it vibrate and know someone texted or is calling me. For the price, you can not get anything better.
customer_reviews.author: Tank

customer_reviews.title: Pebble Smart Watch
customer_reviews.text: Later in life so these modern devices can surely confuse me. Read-up on 'Smart' watches, decided on the Pebble from Amazon. Also, to me Amazon has proven over the years to be exceptionally well done and dependable. So, I then paired the Pebble with my I-Phone 5. Took awhile to understand, yes I know, and six-year-old could have helped me. But. In couple of days I was moving right along with the Pebble. Works great, as advertised, fully satisfied with the purchase. Priced right, delivered as promised, and, it fits! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Raven26

customer_reviews.title: Was falling apart before i opened it still works fine.
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving this two stars because the face plate was completely disconnected from the watch when I opened it. No screws holding it down, just some adhesive goop. 2 stars Update Superglued the faceplate back on, seems to be good now, everything works so far. buttons get pressed when i lean my wrist back too far but thats a given.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty F.

customer_reviews.title: Love my Pebble!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using the pebble smart watch. The notifications are very really nice to have on your wrist. After modifying a lot of the notification settings on my iPhone 5s I have everything running pretty well. It is an early adopter kinda thing right now. If you don't have the patience to work through any issues you may become frustrated. I replaced the rubber watch band with some NATO style bands and then later bought a standard metal link type band. It's a great way to customize the look of your watch. Overall I'm very pleased with my Pebble.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kirkwood

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but the watch has a long development cycle ...
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but the watch has a long development cycle ahead of it. The first one lasted a total of three weeks before it went wonky and ultimately quit. I haven't even opened the replacement and probably won't. Nice toy. Not much real functionality with the exception of some of the exercise tracking apps
customer_reviews.author: Andy M.

customer_reviews.title: What a GEM!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a game changer! Affordable? Yes! Long Lasting? Yes! Notification Support? YES! The main reason I purchased this watch was to receive my notifications on my wrist during meetings. I was surprised at how many notifications are supported, including email! I don't think any wearable devices even come close to this product in terms of price and usability.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Mahabir

customer_reviews.title: Great Smart Watch
customer_reviews.text: LUV my Pebble Watches, I have three. This one is great, lots of Watch Faces, plenty of Apps and iPhone notifications work well and are easy to read. UNLIKE some smart Watches that one must shake or push a button to see display, Pebble's display is always on... Great.
customer_reviews.author: bobbyoneten

customer_reviews.title: Good feel and good looking watch
customer_reviews.text: Good feel and good looking watch. Looks more expensive than it cost. Does what is promises, easy to blue tooth with iPhone 6Plus, notifications of texts, incoming calls, alarms, displays multiple watchfaces in combination with weather, stocks etc. The only objection, which is the reason for the four rather than five stars is the displays dims out and becomes difficult to ready until the watch is shaken or buttons pushed.
customer_reviews.author: etabri

customer_reviews.title: Very handy gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that this thing is waterproof. I don't have to worry at all about getting it wet in the rain or when I wash my hands. Reading my emails while I'm in the shower is so cool! Battery life is great. I'll usually get nearly a week on one charge. I think I'll give this one away to a family member and upgrade to the Steel in the future. That's my only gripe about this watch. It can look a little cheapo... especially when compared to the newer Steel line.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Loved it! But went swimming one time and was ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! But went swimming one time and was in shallow water the whole time for maybe a 2 hour swim and it broke. I called the company and the sent me a new one and I love it. Staying away from water though! Even though they still felt like I should be able to swim with it. I didn't want to chance it again. Very helpful team of people.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Useful, but I didn't find any killer app yet
customer_reviews.text: You won't miss anymore phone calls, messages or notifications. It is nice to wear and easy to use. But until now I didn't find any killer app yet. I mostly use this as a watch that warns me if anything happens on the phone. A big pro is that, turning it off during the night, the battery lasts more than one week! Keeping it on 24 hours a day, it can still last 4 or 5 days.
customer_reviews.author: Lorentz

customer_reviews.title: ... watch for about 2 years now and i still love it. I don't use nearly all of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for about 2 years now and i still love it. I don't use nearly all of the features but it does what i want, it tells time and lets me know when my phone is ringing or when i have a text message. Everyone once in a while it does start to glitch, at which point i just restart it. For what it is, it is a great buy and i am very upset that the company does not exist anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Decker

customer_reviews.title: I loved this watch
customer_reviews.text: I loved this watch, I would consider myself to be pretty on the tech geek side though. I did upgrade to a Moto 360 after owning this watch for the step counting, which I understand the Pebble has since added, and heart rate monitor, which I understand is iffy in reliability. I miss the readability of the E-ink screen and the great battery life of the Pebble. If you are on the fence about whether or not a smartwatch is useful to you I would suggest start with the Pebble.
customer_reviews.author: taf

customer_reviews.title: Good luck getting the color you ordered
customer_reviews.text: Good luck getting the color you ordered. I ordered white and received black and red. To return it, I need to go to ups, as pick up is no available with this product. To me this is an epic fail. Not interested in attempting to buy it again. Who the heck knows what color I'll get.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing

customer_reviews.title: Handier than a shirt pocket!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my iPhone 6. It's the kind of thing you don't think you need until you have one. It's incredibly convenient to be notified with a buzz on the wrist. Example - I was out plowing the driveway on my 4 wheeler in our lovely 11F weather, with my phone buried in an inside pocket. My watch buzzed and without removing my gloves I could see if I needed to respond or not. (It was my wife sending me a 'coffee is ready' message through Whatsapp). Battery so far lasts at least 4-5 days. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Pebble Watch Awesome for 2mos.  Pixel leakage already.  2nd Watch.
customer_reviews.text: My parents purchased me a pebble black watch it's only the middle of March and I already have pixel leakage into the face screen. I purchased two white pebble watches for a coworker and a friend and I'm hoping the same thing doesn't happen to their watches. My mom had to return my watch and get me another one because it wouldn't charge due to poor contact with the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Darr

customer_reviews.title: Get it!!! What are you thinking?
customer_reviews.text: I came from a Sony LiveView smartwatch that is not a bad watch but the bluetooth connection is pretty a pain on the neck... I read a lot of reviews before a bought this watch and defenitely theres not regrets... The epaper screen of its pretty awesome you can see over any light and at night the backlight its pretty cool. The watch its really well made and the bluetooth connection its very stable... If you like touchscreen watches this is not your watch... Im happy with my pebble... I hope this review help somebody to be so happy as I am right now....
customer_reviews.author: Cristian Contreras

customer_reviews.title: It's a very basic smart watch. It's pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got had a broken back button. But I returned it and got one that worked. It's a very basic smart watch. It's pretty cool. Just try not to lose the charger because it is very unique and you would need to find a specific charger
customer_reviews.author: Costa

customer_reviews.title: Easy to unlink
customer_reviews.text: Watch works very well. Displays email, text, alarms, appointments, and phone calls. Sometimes looses contact with the phone. There is no warning, you just notice it has been a long time between alerts. Easy to unlink, and relink, but why does it happen? Operation is not consistent. Was possible to delete individual emails, at the moment it is not. Customer service is nonexistent, I requested assistance the day I got it, no reply after weeks. I works about 3 days on a charge, recharges in about 30 min. I would still buy it again at the price, but would not pay over $75.00, it is just not reliable enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but not always perfect
customer_reviews.text: I mainly got this watch for the Runkeeper interface. It seemed to work perfectly at first but I noticed that if you pause Runkeeper for too long it loses the connection (and good luck getting it back!). I also somehow encountered an issue with it connecting to my phone at all but went through the troubleshooting and eventually corrected it. I am looking forward to the improvements that are sure to come with this watch!
customer_reviews.author: Micheal in Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Does what is is supposed to do, sort of.
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with this watch. While it did most of the things it was described as being able to do, it was more of a hassle than just carrying my phone around. The one app I was most interested in, Misfit, doesn't sync with an android phone at this time. But, I didn't see this mentioned anywhere when I purchased. I ended up returning the item. It was just too tedious for me to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. I've worn it every day since getting it, and get a lot of questions about it. Have shown it to friends and co-workers and they think its cool too. Some of the apps eat the battery, so you have to be careful about that. Only other complaint is sometimes with updates its a pain to get the thing to reconnect, but I always get it sorted out after a bit. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. I have had to return three watches because the screen malfunctioned. And recently was told that the iOs system I am using isn't compatible with the watch causing it to malfunction. Customer service is hard to get a hold of and not very responsive when you ask questions.
customer_reviews.author: Philip W.

customer_reviews.title: Watch started great. Then IOS 9
customer_reviews.text: Watch started great. Then IOS 9.3.1 and you find out it isn't compatible. Then you deal with customer service where I begged for someone to call me or a number to call them. Will never happen and after weeks upon weeks of dealing with poor customer service still no resolution. What a shame because this is a low cost alternative to the apple watch which fit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: John L Albertini

customer_reviews.title: A trend that will interest you for a couple weeks, then will end up your junk drawer.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure the next generation (or the one after) will be much better, but this version just isn't that impressive. Sure, it works just as promised and does everything it should - but the fact that it needs to be charged every few days and really just serves as another way to get your texts/alerts from your phone means that there's not a whole lot of practicality to it. It makes a good gift for someone who has everything, but I recommend waiting until the 2nd or 3rd generation comes out.
customer_reviews.author: R. Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Has screen problems.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the watch when it worked. Problem is it wasn't long. The screen became scrambled and unreadable. Pebble did warranty it and send me another very promptly but the replacement did the same thing. This time the warranty had expired (one year.) If you are looking for a great watch that you can keep trading out for a year then pull the trigger. It's awesome but be prepared to spend the money again after the year is up.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher H.

customer_reviews.title: good functionality but the watch itself isn't great for active ...
customer_reviews.text: good functionality but the watch itself isn't great for active lifestyles, mine had issues after the playing volleyball and being jarred from bumps and sets (wore it on my non dominant hand and the ball never made contact with it).
customer_reviews.author: Zaq

customer_reviews.title: Arrived dead and would not charge
customer_reviews.text: Watch arrived dead Tried charging for a day and a night and it still would not turn on The only think it did with charger attached is flash the word pebble
customer_reviews.author: Eric Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Got it, because I am a gadget guy! I really like it, because I normally carry my phone in my pants pocket and many times in the past I never knew I had a call or a text or message even with vibrate on. This is great because I can see who is calling or read the message without taking the phone out of my pocket. I know it doesn't do a lot of stuff that would be cool, but it works for me!!
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: I haven't wore a watch in 5 years and now I feel lost without my Pebble.
customer_reviews.text: What a slick little device. Pairs seamlessly with iPhone 5. Alerts come to watch about 2-3 seconds after they go to phone. On occasion it will lose connection with phone but repairs itself again when in range. I like that you can change the watchface and also add apps. You can set shortcut buttons and customize the watch too.
customer_reviews.author: Signilicrad

customer_reviews.title: Very cool device, very good price
customer_reviews.text: Very cool device, very good price. Paired with Android, there are all kinds of things you can do. I created my own watch face with an app called Canvas. I do have trouble with the Bluetooth getting disconnected. I have to manually reconnect every other day or so. It is a first gen device, so I would recommend the average person hold off on this model unless they are willing to put up with a few bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: Just got it, works great, love it. I bought this and paired it with my iPhone 6+ running iOS 8.2 with no problems. I've been getting all my text messages on the phone and overall works great. Although I've only had it for a day now, I have not had any issues with it. For the price, batttery life and functionality I am totally sold that this is the best smart watch in the market as of now.
customer_reviews.author: M.M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Decent watch but has some issues
customer_reviews.text: Pebble support was excellent. They sent me a new watch when I inquired about a scrambled display. Unfortunately the new watch also has its issues with display noise. If I reboot it a few times it usually helps. I have a Motorola Droid Ultra and it works ok. The generic aspect makes it hard to get too excited about any of the features.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kudym

customer_reviews.title: I really like the watch
customer_reviews.text: I really like the watch. I had to have my younger nephew activate it (I am not computer savvy) but I find it very useful to getting text notification and the timer function is very useful in my line of work. The band has a lot of give for little and big wrists. I have a tiny wrist and it fits me too. There are so many faces to choose from too. It is very light. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lise H.

customer_reviews.title: So far not happy with the $65 investment
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I recd item it was totally dead, I’ve been charging for 4 hours, still dead with no response or ability to turn on. Letting it charge overnight in hopes it will turn on tomorrow. So far not happy with the $65 investment.**Update: after letting it charge all night long it still would not turn on. I repackaged and returned.
customer_reviews.author: Kent smith

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this watch
customer_reviews.text: Battery no good connection terrible I know now why they lowered price because watch is garbage. Don’t waste your time and if u return it they won’t help u . Trust me I’m trying to return it for two weeks now . Biggest headache
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: The Display Turns Into Stripes
customer_reviews.text: Please don't buy this! It started out great but after a few months the display became striped and unreadable. I returned the first one I bought and got a replacement. The same thing happened again. I will say that when it worked, it was awesome but I am so disappointed that both of them broke.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

product_meta.title: Pebble Smart Watch for iPhone and Android Devices (Red)
product_meta.description:
Color:RedPebble 1.5 Red- Retail

NOTE:

If you are experiencing any display issues with your screen (e.g. dead pixels), please try doing a factory reset on the watch first, to remove any potentially harmful apps. To restore your Pebble to factory settings, select Settings from the main menu, then choose Factory Settings, which is the very last option.
feature_bullets: View notifications from email, SMS, Caller ID, calendar and your favorite apps on your wrist.
Includes Pebble timeline, a chronological display of calendar and notifications
Download watch faces and apps to suit your style and interests.
Control music playing on iTunes, Spotify, Pandora and more.
Rechargeable battery lasts 5-7 days on a single charge
Compatible with both Apple (iOS 6 and higher) and Android devices (OS 4.0 and higher)
